parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Waypoints

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Adds (or inserts when index is given) a new waypoint to a group.

The waypoint is placed randomly within a circle with the given center and radius.

The function returns a waypoint with format [group, index].<br><br> 
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Prior to Arma 3 v1.90, if you need exact waypoint placement, use [[setWaypointPosition]]</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> groupName '''addWaypoint''' [center, radius, index, name]
 
</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>  groupName: [[Group]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> center: [[PositionAGL]] ([[PositionASL]] if ''radius'' is negative!) or [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> radius: [[Number]] - random waypoint placement within ''radius'' from ''center'' <template><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Since Arma 3 v1.90, -1 may be used for exact waypoint placement</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> index (optional): [[Number]] - can be used to insert a waypoint in between existing waypoints

</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> name (optional): [[String]] - [[waypointName]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - format [[Waypoint]] - [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[Group]], ''index'']
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_wp <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext>_grp [[addWaypoint]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[position]] [[player]], 0];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[waypoints]], [[createGuardedPoint]], [[deleteWaypoint]], [[copyWaypoints]], [[move]], [[setCurrentWaypoint]], [[setWaypointBehaviour]], [[setWaypointCombatMode]], [[setWaypointCompletionRadius]], [[setWaypointDescription]], [[setWaypointFormation]], [[setWaypointHousePosition]], [[setWaypointPosition]], [[setWaypointScript]], [[setWaypointSpeed]], [[setWaypointStatements]], [[setWaypointTimeout]], [[setWaypointType]], [[setWaypointVisible]], [[waypointAttachVehicle]], [[waypointAttachedVehicle]], [[setWaypointLoiterRadius]], [[waypointLoiterRadius]], [[setWaypointLoiterType]], [[currentWaypoint]], [[waypointName]], [[waypointSpeed]], [[setWPPos]]
</value></part></template>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>ofpe</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma1</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma2</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on November 26, 2009</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:tijmenjoppe|tijmenjoppe]]</dt>
<dd class="note">In game versions prior to Arma 3 v1.22:
If you add a waypoint to your group and then want them to start moving to that waypoint, make sure to call [[setWaypointType]] "MOVE" on your waypoint.
</dl>


<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 21, 2014 - 20:38 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Giova|Giova]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
if you want to create a waypoint of type "MOVE" and set it as actual waypoint, you can use the [[move]] command that does everything for you with only one line of code !<br>Be aware that [[move]] command   intercepts multiple waypoints and it will not line up in waypoints queue. In other word it is a quick solution if you want your group to get only one waypoint, but for several waypoints you'll have to use addwaypoint and all setwaypointXXXXXX commands around.<br>see [[move]] command.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 4, 2014 - 23:49 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:ThorViking|ThorViking]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The waypoint may not be created exactly at the center position even if radius is zero. The position will be moved away if there are e.g. rocks at the center position or if it is placed at the edge of water on a shore.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
